擦.definition: to rub; to scratch; to wipe; to polish; to apply (lipstick, lotion etc); to brush (past); to shred (a vegetable etc)

擦亮眼睛.definition: to keep one's eyes open (idiom); to be on one's guard; to be clear-eyed

擦傷.definition: to abrade; to scrape; to chafe; to graze; abrasion; friction burn; scratch

擦屁股.definition: to wipe one’s ass; (fig.) (coll.) to clean up sb else's mess

擦掠.definition: to brush against; to graze; to scratch

擦撞.definition: to sideswipe (a car etc); to generate (sparks) by striking a flint; (fig.) to produce (sth novel) through interaction

擦槍走火.definition: to shoot accidentally while polishing a gun; (fig.) a minor incident that sparks a war

擦洗.definition: to clean (with water or alcohol); to wipe and wash; to swab; to scrub

擦澡.definition: to rub down with a wet towel; to give a sponge bath

擦絲.definition: to grate (cheese, carrots etc); to shred

擦肩而過.definition: to brush past; to pass by (sb); (fig.) to miss (an opportunity, a danger etc); to have a brush (with death)

擦邊.definition: to make light contact with the edge of sth; (fig.) to be nearly (a certain age); to be close to (danger); (fig.) to be marginal (in terms of relevance or legality)

擦邊球.definition: (table tennis) edge ball; (fig.) actions that are technically legal but perhaps not respectable
